question_text: 129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 133 We should get rid of elections and parliaments and have experts make decisions on behalf of the people.
129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 134 I think I have the ability to participate in politics.

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 135 Sometimes politics and government seems so complicated that a person like me can't really understand what is going on.

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 136 People like me don't have any influence over what the government does.

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 137 You can generally trust the people who run our government to do what is right.

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 138 A citizen should always remain loyal only to his country, no matter how imperfect it is or what wrong it has done.
129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 139 Women should not be involved in politics as much as men

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 144 Harmony of the community will be disrupted if people organize lots of groups

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 146 If the government is constantly checked [i.e. monitored and supervised] by the legislature, it cannot possibly accomplish great things

129 Do you agree or disagree with the following statement: "Democracy may have its problems, but it is still the best form of government". 147 If we have political leaders who are morally upright, we can let them decide everything

question_text: 55 For the sake of the family, the individual should put his personal interests second. In a group, we should sacrifice our individual interest for the sake of the group's collective interest.

55 For the sake of the family, the individual should put his personal interests second. When dealing with others, developing a long-term relationship is more important than securing one's immediate interest.
